description: This is the website for Andrea Lynn Ferguson, registered psychotherapist (qualifying). I designed and developed the site between May and June 2025.

This is the website for Tony Matthews, a seasoned producer and studio leader with 25+ years of experience in animation, digital media, and immersive storytelling. I designed and developed the site between March and June 2025.

This is a guided walking tour app for Point Pelee National Park and Leamington, Ontario, developed using the open-source Pytheas framework. In the summer of 2025, I developed the application working alongside Randy Topliffe and Doug Sartori, with funding and support from P42 Systems, Windsor Hackforge, and the Leamington BIA. Research and curation by Doug Sartori and Kat Sartori.

This is an online resource collecting information on how to update legal names, gender markers, and identity documents in Ontario, Canada. I have led workshops on name and gender marker changes since 2021, and have worked on versions of this platform for several years. The current version was initially launched in March 2025.

This is a website for Poe M. Allphin—a PhD student in musicology at the CUNY Graduate Center and an adjunct lecturer at Queens College. I designed and developed the site between February and April 2025.
This is a website for Hazel Henry—a dynamic rock producer based in Portland, Oregon—that I designed and developed between January and April 2025.

This is a website for Samantha Dolores Sanchinel—a PhD candidate and course instructor in the Women and Gender Studies program at the University of Toronto. I designed and developed the site between February and May 2025.
This is a website for Jupiter Autumn Wildwood (a.k.a. OrbWitch)—a maker, writer, and witch based in Tkaronto/Toronto, Ontario—that I designed and developed between February and May 2025.
This is a website for social historian Aino Pihlak. I designed and developed the site in November and December 2024.
This is a website for book editor Ryan Perks. I designed and developed the site between December 2024 and February 2025.
This is a website for Michael Cloud Duguay—a composer, producer, improviser, and accordionist from Peterborough, Ontario—that I designed and developed in 2024.

This is a website for Connect Fund—a not-for-profit organization funding healthcare for 2SLGBTQ+ communities in Canada. The site launched in summer 2024, and I remain on-call for periodic updates and support as well as miscellaneous graphic design work.
This is a website for True History Brewing, a brewery and taproom in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The site was initially launched in March 2024.
This is a website for Nina Milanovski, dance artist and producer. I designed and developed the site in February and March 2024.

This is a guided walking tour app for the 2SLGBTQAI+ community in Windsor-Essex, Ontario, developed using the open-source Pytheas framework. In 2023, I was the lead developer on the application, working alongside Haley Tibbitts and Zhenia Tomé, with funding and support from P42 Systems and Windsor Hackforge. Research for the tour was provided by Walter Cassidy.
This is a website for Sydney Gautreau's editing & writing coaching business. It was originally designed and developed in 2022, and received style and functionality upgrades in 2023 and 2024.
